moves.3... b5 4. a4: Undermining the Pawn support. Note that 4... P-QR3? 5 PxP PxP?? 6 RxR costs Black a piece.
moves.6... c6 7. e3: Supporting my bastion and opening a line for the KB.
moves.7... a6 8. b3: Forcing Black to exchange his advanced P or lose it.
moves.9... Nd7 10. d5: Opening more lines, as I have a time advantage.
moves.10... Bxf1 11. Rxf1: Black exchanges a developed piece for an undeveloped one, giving me more tempi.
moves.11... cxd5 12. Nxd5: My time and spatial advantages outweigh the Pawn minus.
moves.12... e6 13. Nf4: Once again focusing on the K-side.
moves.15... g5 16. Nh5: I advance on the vulnerable wing.
moves.16... h6 17. Ke2: Rooks connected, completing development. Black needs several more moves to finish his.
moves.17... f5 18. Rfd1: Threatening a discovered attack on the Q.
moves.18... a4 19. Bb4: Black must now concede the Q file.
moves.20... Qxc5 21. Qxe6+: Black's K has no help from his friends.
